intro: Condylocarpon intermedium subsp. laxum, commonly known as the laxum subspecies of the genus Condylocarpon, is a type of lichen that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Trapeliaceae and is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is loosely attached to its substrate. The lichen typically grows on bark, soil, or rocks in temperate regions. Its morphology includes a distinct upper cortex and a more loosely structured medulla. This subspecies is often used in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
